lead_paragraph: Lindsay Davenport was taken by the Newport Beach Breakers with the top pick in the World TeamTennis marquee player draft. Davenport, who is back on the WTA tour after giving birth to her first child in June, will be playing her eighth WTT season. Andy Roddick was the second choice in the draft, going to the St. Louis Aces. Other top players selected included Serena Williams, taken by the new Washington Kastles; her sister Venus, drafted by the Philadelphia Freedoms; and Martina Navratilova, headed to the Boston Lobsters.
